fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Trade, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Enlargement, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: EU institutional changes, EU and Eurozone economic governance, Europe as a global actor: EU foreign and defence policy. EU enlargement and European Neighbourhood Policy (ENP), Citizenship, Structural and Investment Funds, Climate policy
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
source: EC Representation to the Czech Republic
belgium_office_address: 77 avenue de la Toison d' Or
goals__remit: EUROPEUM Institute for European Policy is a non-proﬁt, non-partisan, and independent think-tank focussing on European integration and cohesion. EUROPEUM contributes to democracy, security, stability, freedom, and solidarity across Europe as well as to active engagement of the Czech Republic in the European Union. EUROPEUM undertakes original research, organizes public events and educational activities, and formulates new ideas and recommendations to improve European and Czech policy making.
